page.title: 03Mortimer Doctor's Surgery
page.content: The surgery was modernised last year. The site was once the village doctor's garden. Waiting room and surgery were in his house, amounting to an early community centre. His son is now principal doctor of the practice. 36 people work at the surgery: doctors-6; practice nurses-2; district nursing sisters-3; dispensers-3; nursing auxiliaries-3; receptionists-7(3 full- time); dietician-1; physiotherapist-1; school nurse-1; midwife-1; dispensary assistants(part-time)-2; Speech therapist-1(weekly); Cleaners-2; chiropodist-1(monthly); Health visitors-2. In one quiet week 518 patients visited the doctor. The computerised programme calls children for tetanus, diptheria, peritonitis, rubella, polio and BCG injections. Travellers can be injected against typhoid,cholera,hepatitis and malaria.
